body: @arky can you please update this PR so we can review and attempt to merge into main? Thank you

> @Subhajitdas298 I didn't get a chance to try yet. Does this PR address the annoying logging output we see when starting tika-server?

Hi, this does not affect any startup logs. This only deals with, choice of REST handler method. When multiple handlers are valid, say in case of "Accept: */*" header, this priority list will decide which one to choose.
closed in lieu of https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/445
@tballison I've updated the PR. Checks fail due to `MP4ParserTest.java:101`. I don't get same exception at my local environment. Do you have any idea about the reason?
I was just able to replicate that in Java 11 on a Mac.  ubuntu w Java 8 passes... Ugh... I pushed a simple fix for now.
@tballison is there anything left to do for this PR?

Hi
Could someone please approve the "workflow"?
Have a great weekend
Simon
Fixed in `main`.  Thank you!
I believe that we can close this one?
@peterkronenberg can you please resolve the conflicts are we can get this tested and merged?
@tballison  ended up checking in something to replace this
Is there any chance of someone completing this fix?
I've made the fix in 2.1.1-SNAPSHOT.  Please give it a try and make sure it behaves as desired.
Will do. Where can I get this version?
If you're using tika-app, try this: https://repository.apache.org/content/repositories/snapshots/org/apache/tika/tika-app/2.1.1-SNAPSHOT/tika-app-2.1.1-20211020.153421-53.jar
Do you need help resolving conflicts?
Should be closed due to https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/447
I believe this was an older PR.  This has already been approved and integrated into the product
I have verified the fix. It works very nicely. Thanks a lot!
Thank you for the confirmation!

I've been wanting to do something like this forever.  Thank you for opening this PR.  Two things: 1) main is our primary branch now (we've locked and no longer use master), 2) we should figure out how to add these configurations via tika-config.xml. 

If you change the target to `main`, I'll merge this and then try to figure out 2) unless you have any recs...
Oh, we should also add some unit tests...at some point.
I think this is fixed now and this can be closed?  If not, please let me know.
Works for me! Here's the PR on main: https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/456
Merged into main
yes, it duplicates the fix in 3206388 - in case it's of interest: this PR includes a unit test. If not, I'll close the PR soon.
Creating a TIKA-3446 branch in our repo
Working on checkstyle now

I've made cosmetic changes to pass checkstyle and forbidden-apis, and I lowercased a bunch of stuff.  I'm going to run some fuzzed files through it and see if I can trigger any problems, and I'm going to run tests multithreaded.

I'd like to normalize some of the metadata properties or use standard ones.  Other than that, is this ready to go if all extra tests look good?
Other point... is it ok to change runtime exceptions to TikaExceptions, generally?

> Other point... is it ok to change runtime exceptions to TikaExceptions, generally?

Yup.

> I've made cosmetic changes to pass checkstyle and forbidden-apis, and I lowercased a bunch of stuff. I'm going to run some fuzzed files through it and see if I can trigger any problems, and I'm going to run tests multithreaded.

Excellent you are my hero!

> I'd like to normalize some of the metadata properties or use standard ones. 

Yeah of course. Feel free to make whatever changes you desire. 

> Other than that, is this ready to go if all extra tests look good?

Yes. I can followup with some improvement PRs later after I get a chance to ask some questions to Microsoft.

closing this. we opened a new branch in the actual repo instead of my forked repo.
https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/461
@tballison am I OK to use stringutils3 in the 1.x branch?
@nddipiazza I think the goal is to keep tika-core as slim as possible, but you can put whatever you need in tika-parsers, as long as we don't have any conflicts.
OK @tballison got a moment for a quick review on this one? Is this OK to add into the upcoming 1.x release?
Looks good to me.  Y, go for it.
Thank you for this.  I made the upgrades before I saw your PR.  I've kicked off the release cycle for both 2.2.1-rc2 and 1.28-rc2 (well, will shortly).
This is critical.  I'm going to respin 2.2.1.  Thank you for finding this!

Hi @arend-von-reinersdorff I didn't see this before my apologies.
This is superseded by #469 
Thank you so much for the contribution.
Hi @lsliwko please open a [JIRA ticket](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/TIKA). Then follow the above guidelines. If you need assistance please let us know. Thank you
@fredster33 please resolve conflicts and open a JIRA ticket. If you need assistance please let us know. Thanks
Hi @lsliwko it looks like this PR is superseded by #451 correct?
#451 additionally adds parsing of wav file comments (as xmpDM:logComment). Both changes #282 and #451 go together.
@lewismc Thanks for upgrading the rome dependency :-) They sure were quick with version 1.18.0

Hi @lsliwko I'm confused as the pull request modifications in both #451 and this one look identical. Also no JIRA ticket exists for these proposals. Please create a JIRA ticket.
I have never used or developed the [tika-external-parsers.xml](https://github.com/apache/tika/blob/main/tika-core/src/main/resources/org/apache/tika/parser/external/tika-external-parsers.xml) file before but your pull request looks great as it is adding rather than attempting to change any existing source code.

Here you go - JIRA ticket:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TIKA-3637
Duplicated in https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/282
Sorry, you were right the code was duplicated in other pull request. I closed https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/451.
Thank you!  I just merged https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/474 which fixed this.

Thank you for opening this.  I don't want to add more work for you, but this PR is too big for me to handle in one go.

Can we break it up in PRs either by module or by severity?  Or better yet, add a findbugs maven plugin to our project so that this isn't a fix-once-and-hope-for-the-best-in-the-future kind of thing?

I expect some opposition from other members of the team: Findbugs isn't maintained any longer and maven reports a warning about the structure of pom.xml when I add a section for findbugs. As for separate change lists for modules, I think it's feasible.

I used to use Findbugs on other projects and admire many of its features.  After you opened this and I made my comment, I went digging a bit and found what you point out: no longer supported.  I'd like to make many of the changes you found, but I'd also like to make this more of a lasting contribution somehow.  Maybe sonarqube, e.g. https://sonarcloud.io/project/overview?id=apache_any23 ???

I will check sonarqube
Meanwhile, PR for module CORE https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/478

Hi @dk2k thanks for creating a PR 👍 
I think the site report generation is obviously important!
I take it that the other proposed changes in this PR outside of those to `pom.xml` are related to the spotbugs analysis?
Also, @dk2k please open a JIRA ticket so that this contribution can be included in the release report.
@lsliwko I just noticed that this PR is created against `master` branch. Please close it and create the PR aginst `main` branch. We will not merge it into `master`.

Hi @lewismc ,
thanks for picking the PR up.
Indeed, all the changes outside POM are a reaction to found issues.
Created Jira ticket https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TIKA-3649
Later will post similar PRs for the rest of the modules.
@tballison I reiterate that I know nothing about osgi or about the tika build generally but this change seems to get the tika-bundles build further than it was getting before
@tballison I got the tika-bundles tests to pass with these changes (I did a few commits, all the commits are needed)
LGTM.  Thank you, @lewismc !
We can't do this because later versions of fakeload depend on versions of Java > 8.  We can upgrade once we require java 11.
I don't think we can do this because cxf is built on 9.x.  If there were a way to get notifications for specific major versions from @dependabot, that'd be great.
@grossws do we want to get this into the next release for 2.x?  I can try my hand at resolving conflicts if that'd be of any use.
Closed as requested. New PR: https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/492
New PR to main as requested in https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/282
@tballison, I think it's good idea for 2.3. I'll just update PR and merge it afterwards

I merged this and made a few modifications.  I need to figure out how to do a better job of passing tikaconfig info into DefaultZipDetector.

Thank you @simon-shlomo for opening this!
Need to coordinate upgrade with s3 version.  Will push once I get a clean build.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`. You can also ignore all major, minor, or patch releases for a dependency by adding an [`ignore` condition](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/supply-chain-security/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#ignore) with the desired `update_types` to your config file.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.
@dependabot ignore this minor version
OK, I won't notify you about version 0.8.x again, unless you re-open this PR or update to a 0.8.x release yourself.
0.8.5 and 0.8.6 were built with Java > 8 and were not built with the correct release version.  These are incompatible with java 8.  See, e.g. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-310
Oops.  I didn't mean to shut off minor version.  I meant to shut off patch version.  Oh, well.
@dependabot ignore this dependency
OK, I won't notify you about com.martensigwart:fakeload again, unless you re-open this PR or update it yourself. 😢
Any objections to merge?
@dependabot ignore this major version
OK, I won't notify you about version 11.x.x again, unless you re-open this PR or update to a 11.x.x release yourself.
Thank you @dk2k
Looks like SNAPHOT version of tika-server cannot be found! Will look into it more next week.
@fredster33 PING
@arky can you please rebase?
@dependabot ignore this major version
OK, I won't notify you about version 10.x.x again, unless you re-open this PR or update to a 10.x.x release yourself.
@nddipiazza just wondering if you got anywhere with this?

@monkmachine hi i did not end up needing this for my project and abandoned ship. you need it? 
it needs a couple hours of effort applying the fixes tim suggested.
@nddipiazza Yeah would be good, we're about to start doing some work with DWG's.
Superseded by #506.
@dependabot ignore this dependency
OK, I won't notify you about org.scala-lang:scala-library again, unless you re-open this PR or update it yourself. 😢
The updated version of scala had some breaking changes.  We are effectively no longer maintaining the age-recogniser.  If anyone wants to dive in and clean up the dependencies, have at it!

This fails because we had a different version.property for s3 and the transcriber, and this only changed one.  They both rely on underlying aws components and have to be updated at the same time.  I'm going to update our code so that we only have one version.property for aws components.  If we need two, we can revert.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`. You can also ignore all major, minor, or patch releases for a dependency by adding an [`ignore` condition](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/supply-chain-security/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#ignore) with the desired `update_types` to your config file.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

Y. Sorry.  Fixed now.  There were a bunch of others.

Now I get

```
Rule 0: org.apache.maven.plugins.enforcer.DependencyConvergence failed with message:
Could not build dependency tree Could not collect dependencies: org.apache.tika:tika-parser-scientific-module:jar:2.3.1-SNAPSHOT ()
```

See also at the bottom of
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MENFORCER-393
Thank you, Tilman.  I was able to get a local build, but clearly this is not working as is.  I'll try your exclusion of osgi.core from log4j-core.
I'm getting a clean local build even when I remove previously built artifacts from my local m2 repo.  However, this is still not working in github ci/cd.  I've reverted to 3.0.0-M3 for now.
Superseded by #515.

Sorry, late to the party... I think maybe the new \nX- 0:1024 could cause false positives in regression tests. If yes, I would check for additional headers after it matches, like done for mbox mimetype.

Also, if we look for additional headers if X|DKIM|ARC matches at the beginning, why not look for other headers if they match in a wide range of positions? (ok there is the \n but it is pretty common in txt files).

Maybe we could use a regex to put all definitions together, regardless if they are at the beginning of the file or at the beginning of lines in the first 1024...
